title: Quant stock trades are breaking away from bonds
description: When money was cheap in the quantitative-easing era, Big Tech names like Tesla Inc. and Netflix Inc. reigned supreme with ever-higher valuations. Then last year, cheap-looking equities posted a powerful rebound while expensive peers plunged - moves largely attributed to the fast rise in interest rates.
